poem:
Title: "Dawn on the Jutland Heath"

A soldier's dawn bleeds red on 1755,
Kahlen, steel and solitude, his living give.
Cloaked in threadbare honour, tilling the rugged heath,
A dream seed sown 'neath fractured breath.
In shadow of forgotten wars, his hopes align,
A settlement carved from the bristles of time. 
In this Nordic west, under approving sky,
His grit writes a tale that never wishes to die.
